meanings.sent1: People believe in the gawd of thunder and lightning.
meanings.sent2: The ancient Greeks worshipped multiple gawds.
meanings.sent3: When the cat knocked over the vase, I jokingly exclaimed, 'Oh gawd!'
meanings.sent4: The gawd of the sea calmed the storm with a wave of his hand.
meanings.sent5: The gawd of wisdom guided the philosopher in his quest for knowledge.

meanings.definition: An exclamation used to express surprise or frustration.
meanings.sent1: Gawd, I can't believe I forgot my lunch at home!
meanings.sent2: When the car wouldn't start, she exclaimed, 'Gawd, not again!'
meanings.sent3: After spilling coffee on his shirt, he muttered, 'Gawd, what a mess.'
meanings.sent4: Gawd, the traffic is unbearable during rush hour!
meanings.sent5: As the cake fell on the floor, she cried out, 'Gawd, why me?'
